summary.para: The CERT_AUTHORITY_KEY_ID2_INFO structure identifies the key used to sign a certificate or CRL. It differs from the structure in that the certificate issuer is a instead of a CERT_NAME_BLOB. Otherwise, the structures are used in the same way.

The key can be identified by an explicit key identifier, by giving a certificate's issuer and serial number, or by both. If both are used, the certificate issuer must ensure that the explicit key identifier, the certificate issuer and the serial number are consistent.
creates an instance of this structure when performed on a structure's Value member with its the structure's pszObjId member set to szOID_AUTHORITY_KEY_IDENTIFIER2.
An instance of this structure can be used as input to to create an appropriate .
A CRYPT_DATA_BLOB structure that contains a unique identifier of a public key.
that includes the encoded name of the CA that issued the certificate. The cAltEntry member of the structure may be set to zero if the name is not to be used to identify the CA.
A CRYPT_INTEGER_BLOB structure that includes the serial number of the certificate associated with the private key used to sign this certificate. For more information, see .
